revised_title: Observations of the Aurora Borealis in Paris and its Effects on Compass Needles and Electrical Machines
tldr: This article describes two observations of the Aurora Borealis in Paris, one in August 1768 and another in December 1768. The author, M. Messier, noticed that during the phenomenon, compass needles lost their usual direction and electrical machines gained an uncommon degree of force. The article also mentions that the Aurora Borealis was observed in other locations like Berlin and Vienna, where similar effects were noticed on compass needles and electrical machines.
